head.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Lebanon: Sunnis' Bodies Found After Kidnapping

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Middle East: Lebanon: Sunnis' Bodies Found After Kidnapping

abstract.p: Lebanese police find bodies of Sunni man and 12-year-old Sunni boy in Beirut; their abduction has already prompted concerns of rising sectarian tensions; their families are members of pro-government party that is opponent of Hezbollah; local reports say two were kidnapped by members of Shiite clan to avenge killing of relative in January (S)

block.p: The police found the bodies of a 25-year-old Sunni man and a 12-year-old Sunni boy whose abduction on Monday had already prompted concerns of rising sectarian tensions. The bodies were found in a field southeast of Beirut after an anonymous call to a television station. Their families are members of the pro-government party of the Druse leader Walid Jumblatt, an opponent of Hezbollah, the militant Shiite organization. Local reports said the two were kidnapped by members of a Shiite clan to avenge the killing of a relative in January. Mr. Jumblatt appealed for calm.
